author: Gina Rushton
title: More Women Are Contacting Family Violence Services In The Coronavirus Outbreak, Frontline Workers Say
description: “While home is undoubtedly the safest place to avoid the coronavirus, it is not the safest place for a woman and child experiencing family and domestic violence,” one frontline worker said. View Entire Post ›
content:
There has been an uptick in women accessing family violence services since the coronavirus outbreak began, and perpetrators are using the pandemic as an excuse for violent and coercive behaviour, according to frontline workers in the Australian sector.
